page.title: 11BROCKHURST
page.content: Brockhurst is an estate to the east of the A22 between East Grinstead and Ashurstwood. It is very secluded and can only really be seen from the railway line.The farm has a fascinat- ing building that serves as a dairy. This dairy is very ornamental and is made out of red and buff bricks laid in a horizontal band.The dairy has a verandah the sole purpose of which is to shield the occupants from the sun. Inside, the building is white-tiled and this with its lancet windows makes the working area very cool and light. The dairy has a double saddled-back roof. The only building similar to this in Britain is at Charthouse Priory near Bath.
